page.title: 20HANBURY GDNS.PYNEST GN.LANE.
page.content: Gardens of Hanbury has a flower garden clubhouse,menage,blacksmith shop,cattle trough,tack house and a barbequeue area.The buildings were built in Victorian style.Eighteenth and nineteenth century materials were used, British Colombian Pine.It took retired journey men 12 years to build it with Georgian bricks.In the old coach house there is a tack room.The coach house houses an old PHEANTON,which is what people used to use before cars were invented.The old gypsy caravan is made of an esham dray base.It is made to be a replica of a showman's wagon.The clubhouse is Elizabethan and has 4 Inguenots inside.Around the edge of the menage are old gas street lamps.Thirty small horses can be stabled in the area,and there are a few acres of grazing land behind the stables. DATA BY 3E EPPING FOREST HIGH SCHOOL.
